# Code of Conduct

## Overview

This project is committed to fostering a welcoming, safe, productive,
and inclusive environment for all contributors and users.

We follow professional standards expected in open-source communities as
well as enterprise engineering organizations.

All participants are expected to uphold this Code of Conduct during all
project interactions, both online and offline.

## Our Standards

Examples of positive behavior:

- Being respectful and constructive
- Demonstrating empathy and understanding
- Giving and gracefully receiving feedback
- Prioritizing community over personal advantage
- Focusing on technical excellence and clarity
- Respecting time, boundaries, and communication channels

Unacceptable behavior includes, but is not limited to:

- Harassment, discrimination, or hate speech of any kind
- Personal attacks, insults, or threats
- Deliberate misinformation or bad-faith conduct
- Doxxing or unauthorized disclosure of private information
- Disruptive behavior or intimidation
- Sexual language or imagery in any professional context
- Using participation to pursue personal gain or influence unrelated
  to the project

## Responsible Security Behavior

To protect users and the open-source ecosystem:

- Never test vulnerabilities on real systems without permission
- Do not disclose exploits publicly without coordinated disclosure
- Report security issues privately using the **Security Policy**
- Do not intentionally introduce vulnerabilities or malicious code

## Enforcement

Instances of unacceptable behavior may result in:

- Warnings
- Temporary restrictions
- Removal from discussions, issues, or PRs
- Permanent bans from the project and related spaces
- Notification to hosting platforms if required
- Additional actions where legally required

Maintainers will enforce this Code consistently and fairly, applying
judgement based on context and impact.

## Reporting Violations

To report unacceptable behavior, please contact the maintainers:

**Email:** dhruv13x@gmail.com
**GitHub Security Advisory Form:** (private security reports)

Reports should include:

- Description of incident
- Links/screenshots (if applicable)
- Date and participants (if known)
- Your preferred contact method

We will respond as quickly as possible â€” typically within **48 business hours**.

All reports are confidential and handled with discretion.

## Appeals

If you feel a resolution was incorrect or unfair, you may request a review via:

- Email to the maintainers
- Alternative contact listed above

## Legal and Compliance

- Participation in this project implies agreement to this Code
- This Code does not supersede local, national, or international laws
- Maintainers may involve legal authorities if safety is threatened

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct builds on:

- Contributor Covenant v2.1
- CNCF & Linux Foundation community guidelines
- OpenSSF secure OSS standards
- GitHub community behavior expectations

## Commitment

By participating in this project, you agree to uphold these values and
support a healthy, respectful, and secure open-source community.

Thank you for helping build a responsible and world-class open-source ecosystem.
